docs.title: Pre-Requisites
docs.text: Open to students enrolled in the M.Eng in Design & Technology Innovation or by application and consent of the instructor.

docs.title: Course Materials Required
docs.text: Students will be provided with course materials. Students will be expected to have access to at least one Duke fabrication facility; at the time of this writing, these include the POD, the Foundry, and the Innovation Co-Lab.

docs.title: Software Required
docs.text:
• TinkerCAD
  • VNC Server
  • Adobe Creative Suite and/or another vector drawing program
  • Python development environment with machine learning libraries (TensorFlow/PyTorch)
  • Figma, Balsamiq
  • Git and GitHub
  • Raspberry Pi

docs.title: Course Description
docs.text:
In this course, students will advance their skills related to three technical toolkits core to design innovation practice:

  • 2D- and 3D-modeling and digital fabrication
  • Machine learning applications in design and prototyping
  • User interface design and interactive experiences across multiple platforms (web, mobile, XR/AR, and physical computing)

The course revolves around extensive in-class experimentation, weekly skill-building assignments, a midterm project, and a final individual project intended to serve as a portfolio-ready piece.

docs.title: Learning Objectives
docs.text:
After completing this course, students will be able to:

  • Design and fabricate 2D and 3D objects using a combination of Adobe Illustrator, TinkerCAD, lasercutters and additive manufacturing
  • Apply machine learning techniques to enhance design processes and outcomes
  • Implement basic ML models for computer vision and generative design
  • Create user-centered interfaces across web, mobile, and XR platforms
  • Design and conduct usability studies
  • Develop interactive prototypes using various technologies
  • Integrate ML capabilities into interactive applications
  • Apply computational and data-driven methods for component design

docs.title: Collaboration Policy
docs.text:
Collaborative learning integrated into the course provides a dynamic learning environment in which to synthesize academic knowledge and experiences. It facilitates communication and critical thinking skills, strengthens leadership capacity, enhances project management skills, and promotes effective teamwork, along with learning to troubleshoot interpersonal/team issues.

Teams shall write and agree upon a team charter outlining team goals, individual goals, milestones and timelines, roles, processes and team norms.

docs.title: Week 1 - Introduction to Design Technology: Bits to Atoms
1. Installing Anaconda
docs.text:
1. Visit the Anaconda download page
  2. Download the macOS installer (choose Apple M1 if you have an M1/M2 Mac, or Windows installer (64-Bit))
  3. Open the downloaded .pkg (or .exe) file and follow the installation wizard
  4. Verify installation by opening Terminal and running:
conda --version
  1. Setting up Git

Install Homebrew (if not already installed):

/bin/bash -c "$(curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Homebrew/install/HEAD/install.sh)"

Install Git using Homebrew:

brew install git

Configure Git with your credentials:

git config --global user.name "Your Name"
git config --global user.email "your.email@example.com"

Verify installation:

git --version
  1. Installing Required Python Packages

Create a new conda environment (optional but recommended):

conda create -n myenv python=3.10
conda activate myenv

Install packages using pip:

pip install streamlit openai anthropic chromadb flask
  1. Installing a Text Editor

Option 1: VS Code

Visit the VS Code download page Download and install the macOS version Install recommended extensions:

Python Pylance

Option 2: Cursor

Visit the Cursor download page Download and install the macOS version Follow the setup wizard to configure AI features

docs.title: Verifying Everything Works
docs.text:
Open Terminal and check Python environment:

python --version

Verify package installation:

pip list

Test Git:

mkdir test-project
cd test-project
git init

Test Python environment with a simple script:

# Create a test.py file in your editor
import streamlit as st
import openai
import anthropic
import chromadb
from flask import Flask

print("All packages imported successfully!")

Run the script:

python test.py
